Main¶

The ‘Driver’ file so to say, run this python file to actually start the app.

It is filled with helper functions for actually getting the app onto your screen, so in that sense it is both the View and Controller of the ‘MVC model’.

chess_main.load_images() → None¶

Fills the IMAGES dictionary with images of the pieces.

Returns:

chess_main.draw_board(screen: Surface) → None¶

Draw the squares of the board onto the screen.

The light squares will be even, 0 is even, and the dark squares are all odd, so just need to modulo 2 to check if a square is odd or even and then colour it in.

Parameters:

screen – The pygame surface that gets drawn on.

Returns:

chess_main.draw_pieces(screen: Surface, board) → None¶

Draw the pieces onto the board.

Parameters:

  • screen – The pygame surface it draws the pieces on, a layer above board.

  • board – The board pygame surface.

Returns:

chess_main.draw_gamestate(screen: Surface, gs: GameState) → None¶

Draw the entire game state onto the screen.

Parameters:

  • screen – The pygame surface that will be drawn upon.

  • gs – The game state, so that we know where the pieces are.

Returns:
